item.title: Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom - Searching for Everyone Walkthrough
item.description:
After Zelda mends the rift in the Suthorn Ruins in Echoes of Wisdom , you'll be reunited with Minister Lefte and unlock a new story quest called "Searching for Everyone." This quest unlocks the majority of Hyrule in Echoes of Wisdom . However, your goal is to mend the giant rifts in Gerudo Desert and Jabul Waters. In doing so, you may run into some familiar faces and learn more about the mysterious Still World.

"Searching for Everyone" Walkthrough (Echoes of Wisdom)

Where to Go First

Although you manage to free Minister Left from the Still World after Suthorn Ruins, you still haven't found Minister Wright, the King, or Link. As Tri explains to Lefte, it's possible they're trapped in other rifts. "Searching for Everyone" is split into two main quests:

  • "A Rift in Gerudo Desert"
  • "The Jabul Waters Rift"

You have the option to go to the desert first or the sea/river. Ultimately, the choice doesn't matter, as you'll need to complete both. However, if you want Swordfighter's Bow ability, then you should head to Gerudo Desert. There are also some incredibly useful Echoes in the Gerudo area, such as the Flying Tile and Platboom. Jabul Waters is home to the Bombfish, which is another extremely useful Echo that you'll be using throughout your playthrough. When you start the story quest for Gerudo Desert and Jabul Waters, you'll have a few story quests with supporting characters before you can enter the giant rifts (ex: "Chaos at River Zora Village"). Only after you've finished both rifts and reunited with Lefte and Wright at Lueberry's House will you unlock the next main quest: "Still Missing."

Things to Do During "Searching for Everyone"

Recommended Echoes, Accessories, and More

You're not on any time limit to complete the giant rifts, so you should build up your Echoes inventory and do some side quests. Nothing's stopping you from going to areas such as Faron Wetlands to obtain Echoes you'd normally get in the late-game phase. However, Tri's power won't exceed level 4 until you've completed "Still Missing." So, while you can obtain Echoes early, you may not be able to use them if they require five triangles of their power.

Some Echoes you may find useful for the dungeons in "Searching for Everyone" are the elemental Keese (Electric Keese (Faron Wetlands), Ice Keese (Holy Mount Lanayru)), Fire Octo and Lizalfos Lv. 2 on Eldin Volcano. You may also want to learn the Buzz Blob Echo in Faron Wetlands. This is a weaker Echo, but it requires fewer triangles than the elemental Keese.

There are two powerful Echoes in the Eternal Forest: Sword Moblin Lv. 3 and Lynel. However, until Tri has 5 and 6 triangles respectively, you won't be able to use them.

You should also go to Hyrule Ranch (west of Hyrule Castle Town) and do the "Runaway Horse" side quest, which unlocks the rental horses. Zelda will get her own horse in a later side quest, but for now, the rentals will do. If you head west of Hyrule Ranch, you'll find Kakariko Village. Here, you can do the "Cuccos on the Loose" side quest to get a Fairy Bottle .

There are also Heart Pieces that can be obtained from caves or side quests. Some of these Heart Pieces can only be reached with a specific Echo, like Holmill. You can also look for Might Crystals to upgrade Swordfighter Form. You won't be able to upgrade the sword/energy/bow to max level until you've completed "Still Missing." However, you should at least farm enough Might Crystals to build up Swordfighter's Energy and Sword before returning to Hyrule Castle Town.

Finally, you should visit the Great Fairy at Lake Hylia. Lake Hylia is north of Lueberry's house, and you can reach it by using a Crawltula Echo to scale the trees/cliffs. The Great Fairy will expand your Accessory Limit, allowing Zelda to equip more than one Accessory. During "Searching for Everyone," it's unlikely you'll be able to get upgraded Accessories, such as the Curious Charm. However, it's recommended you at least have two Accessory slots before starting the next story quest ("Still Missing").

item.title: Roblox: Eat Blobs Simulator Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
Eat Blobs Simulator is an excellent representative of Io games on the Roblox platform. Being a large hemisphere, you must absorb smaller spheres or smaller opponents to become the strongest on the server. You'll get a decent point boost by spinning the fortune wheel and collecting daily bonuses, but you can also use Eat Blobs Simulator codes to reach the top of the ranking table.

Using codes, you will get a decent size boost. You can use all the codes at once to instantly become the strongest or use them one at a time to get a boost every time you enter the game world. But, remember that the codes have a limited expiration date, keep in mind to take advantage of the freebies.

Updated October 17, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: New codes have been released, and we’ve added them to the guide. Take advantage of them now.

All Eat Blobs Simulator Codes

Working Eat Blobs Simulator Codes

  • SPOOKY - Size Boost. (NEW)

  • CARCODE2 - Size Boost.

  • JULY4 - Size Boost.
  • FIREWORK - Size Boost.

  • 2XDAILY - Size Boost.

  • 8THOUSAND - Size Boost.
  • UPD4 - Size Boost.
  • MOMDAY - Size Boost.
  • 7THOUSAND - Size Boost.

Expired Eat Blobs Simulator Codes

  • 50PERCENT
  • UPDATE10
  • FIRSTCODE
  • THANKYOU4
  • THX4LIKES

Even though a fair battle for supremacy and constantly eating small spheres can be quite a fun experience, sometimes everyone wants a little freebie to get on par with other players. Fortunately, the developers understand the players' desires and share codes that will help you save a decent amount of time. Using codes, you can instantly increase your stats to 500,000+ or ​​use just a few codes at a time to save more for later.

How to Redeem Eat Blobs Simulator Codes

Like in most other games on the Roblox platform, you can use codes in Eat Blobs Simulator from the first seconds in the game world. Here's how to do it:

  • Launch Eat Blobs Simulator in Roblox .
  • Click on the Codes icon on the left side of the screen.
  • Enter the code in the Code Goes Here text box.
  • Click redeem, and you will receive your rewards.

How to Get More Eat Blobs Simulator Codes

Like in other Roblox games, the developers of Eat Blobs Simulator add more codes to the game after it reaches new levels of popularity, during events and updates, or as a promotional reward to increase the popularity of their project on the platform. The easiest way to find out about all the new rewards is to check the game description on the Roblox platform periodically, or you can find a list of all the active codes in our guide. You can also subscribe to the official pages of the developers to be the first to know about all the awards:

  • Roblox
  • Discord

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is Releasing With a Budget Price
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is priced at $49.99, much lower than most triple-A titles today.
  • The upcoming turn-based fantasy RPG is now available to pre-order on Amazon.
  • The title is scheduled to be released in Spring 2025.

Sandfall Interactive's upcoming RPG Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 will only cost $49.99. Revealed in June, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is already rising to the top of many player's wishlists, instantly making an impression with its realistic graphics and unique approach to turn-based gameplay.

Audiences were stunned following the reveal of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 during the June 2024 Xbox Games Showcase. Developed by the French Studio Sandfall Interactive, the fantasy RPG features incredibly realistic graphics and aims to combine turn-based combat with real-time commands for a unique and dynamic gameplay experience. The developers were largely inspired by JRPGs, particularly the Final Fantasy and Persona series, already making this an attractive title for fans of these legendary franchises. Despite its level of polish and the hype surrounding it, the game's price is much cheaper than that of most triple-A titles today.

Pre-orders for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 recently went live on Amazon for just $49.99, stunning prospective players. While many are thankful that the fantasy game won't follow the current trend of high-profile titles costing $69.99 or more, others are questioning why the title is being sold for a budget price. As it doesn't look like the developers took any shortcuts when it comes to the game's graphics, many speculate that the title may be smaller than initially thought. Many were hoping for a lengthy open-world game, but Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 could potentially be more linear than previously hinted.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is Available to Pre-Order for $49.99

The voice cast and launch window for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 was recently announced, revealing that the turn-based title was aiming for a Spring 2025 release. Fans can expect a star-studded cast, including Andy Serkis ( The Lord of the Rings ), Jennifer English ( Baldur’s Gate 3 ), and Ben Starr ( Final Fantasy 16 ), among many others. Much about the game remains a mystery, with the game's story teased in recent trailers. The title's protagonists, Gustave and Lune, must seek out and destroy the Paintress, who has the ability to kill everyone of a certain age by writing a number in the sky.

Fans are eager to get their hands on the unique title, but Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 will have plenty of competition. Several major triple-A titles are set to release in early 2025, including Avowed and Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii . However, Sandfall Interactive's upcoming game may just be unique enough to stand on its own, especially given its novel battle system.

item.title: 2024 Video Game Release Date Calendar
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Games in January 2024
  • Games in February 2024
  • Games in March 2024
  • Games in April 2024
  • Games in May 2024
  • Games in June 2024
  • Games in July 2024
  • Games in August 2024
  • Games in September 2024
  • Games in October 2024
  • Games in November 2024
  • Games in December 2024
  • Big 2024 TBA Games

2024 is another fantastic year for video games. Nintendo released a brand-new game starring Princess Peach; Dragon's Dogma finally got a sequel; the next part of the acclaimed Final Fantasy 7 remake came out; Star Wars is getting another open-world adventure, which just scratches the surface. We should expect many more 2024 video game release dates as more presentations happen, like the next State of Play, Nintendo Direct, and all the other online streams.

Interactive Calendar Here

Updated October 17...

Phasmophobia is coming to PS5 and XSX/S on October 29.

Alan Wake 2' s Lake House expansion comes out on October 22.

Temtem: Swarm launches in early access on November 13.

Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii moves up a week.

Animal Well is now available on Xbox.

Blindfire is out today for PC and XSX/S.

So, for the gamers who would like to plan their gaming sessions ahead of time, here's a list of the major video games coming out in 2024 . We'll try to keep this article updated every week or so with any changes, such as delays, cancellations, and new announcements from the big publishers.

We'll list each month below and then have a 2024 TBA list at the bottom. The TBA section will have the 2024 video games that we don't have confirmed dates yet for but are still planned for release in the new year.

  • Games in January 2024

    Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown (PS, Xbox, Switch, PC) - January 18

    The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered (PS5) - January 19

    Palworld (PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S) - January 19

    Another Code Recollection (Switch) - January 19

item.title: 2025 Video Game Release Date Calendar
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Games in January 2025
  • Games In February 2025
  • Games in March 2025
  • Games in April 2025
  • Games in May 2025
  • Games in June 2025
  • Big TBA 2025 Releases

Readers can use this handy dandy gaming release date calendar for 2025 to keep track of the prominent titles coming out. We'll be keeping this post updated as more video game release dates are announced, so make sure to keep this page bookmarked.

Updated on October 17...

-----

Wheel World is coming out in early 2025.

Mistfall Hunter is coming in 2025.

Cronos: The New Dawn is coming in 2025.

Mouse P.I. For Hire is coming in 2025.

Edens Zero is coming in 2025.

33 Immortals has been delayed to 2025.

Check out our Interactive 2025 Release Date Calendar here!

  • Games in January 2025

    Freedom Wars Remastered (PC, PS4, PS5, Switch) - January 10

    Donkey Kong Country Returns HD (Switch) - January 16

    Tales of Graces f Remastered (PS5, PS4, Switch, PC, Xbox One, XSX/S) - January 17

    Dynasty Warriors: Origins (PS5, PC, XSX/S) - January 17

    Star Wars Episode I: Jedi Power Battles (PC, PS4/5, Switch, Xbox One, XSX/S) - January 23

    Lost Records: Bloom and Rage (Tape 1) - (PC, PS5, XSX/S - February 18
